subject: Career
title: Handling Public Criticism
description: A quick, practical guide to Handling Public Criticism.

hook.text: Someone criticizes your work publicly. Your instinct is to fight back. That's usually wrong.

buildup.text: Public disputes amplify attention. The audience often remembers the fight, not who was right.

discovery.text: The 'gray rock' method: respond factually, briefly, without emotion. Deny the drama oxygen.

twist.text: Sometimes the best response is no response. Silence communicates confidence when the attack is weak.

climax.text: If a response is needed: 'Thanks for the feedback. Here's my perspective.' â€” firm but professional.

punchline.text: Defend your work. Never defend your ego publicly.

quiz.question: What is the 'gray rock' method for handling public criticism?
options: Respond factually and briefly without emotion
